page.title: 11HESWALL
page.content:
Heswall is a town near the River Dee. When ever the tides are right the Dee sailing club have races along the Dee. The boats they use are called squibs. Squibs are made out of fibreglass and the mast is metal. More often than not the sails are made out of nylon because it is cheaper than cloth and it is strong and waterproof. When the race is over the sailors all go into the clubhouse for a drink of beer. When they sail, they often sail up to West Kirby. From our house we can see them sailing past.
David Carroll. 10
